See also: feuer

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German fiur, from Proto-Germanic *fōr, from Proto-Indo-European *péh₂wr̥. Compare Low German Füer, Dutch vuur, West Frisian fjoer, English fire, Danish fyr.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈfɔʏər/, [ˈfɔʏ̯ɐ]
  • (Austro-Bavarian, Palatine German, Swabian) IPA(key): /ˈfaɪər/
  • Audio (DE)
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɔɪ̯ɐ

Noun[edit]

Feuer n (genitive Feuers, plural Feuer, diminutive Feuerchen n or Feuerlein n)

  1. fire

Declension[edit]

Declension of Feuer

indef.def.noundef.noun

dativeeinemdemFeuerdenFeuern
